meanings.definition: Elegant or stylish in an upper-class way.
meanings.sent1: The lady wore a posh dress to the fancy party.
meanings.sent2: The posh restaurant had crystal chandeliers and velvet chairs.
meanings.sent3: The posh cat insisted on sleeping on a silk pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her posh manners shone like a diamond in a sea of rocks.
meanings.sent5: The mansion's posh interior left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: To make something more luxurious or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She decided to posh up her room with new curtains.
meanings.sent2: The designer poshed the outfit with sparkling accessories.
meanings.sent3: He poshed up his bicycle with shiny new handlebars.
meanings.sent4: The chef poshed up the dish with a sprinkle of gold flakes.
meanings.sent5: The decorator poshed up the living room with elegant furniture.

meanings.definition: A person who is wealthy and sophisticated.
meanings.sent1: The posh attended the opera in a tailored suit.
meanings.sent2: She mingled with the posh at the exclusive gala.
meanings.sent3: The posh always traveled first class on flights.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the posh of the neighborhood for his lavish parties.
meanings.sent5: The young actress dreamed of becoming a posh in Hollywood.
